metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24106 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Xpdf prior to 4.04, the DCT (JPEG) decoder was incorrectly allowing the 'interleaved' flag to be changed after the first scan of the image, leading to an unknown integer-related vulnerability in Stream.cc.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> debian xpdf is slightly different from upstream xpdf, and does not include Stream.cc file. texlive-bin includes xpdf files. emscripten includes xpdf in the tests and could be ignored.

criterions.comment: emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
texlive-bin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
